channel.title: Rotary International
channel.description: News about Rotary, a global network of business and professional leaders who volunteer their time and talents to serve their communities and the world.

item.title: This month in Rotary history: Rotary’s anniversary
item.description: During the first Rotary club meeting Paul Harris, Gustavus Loehr, Hiram Shorey, and Silvester Schiele met to talk about their personal experiences. Harris then unfolded his general plan for their club meetings.

item.title: Trucking tycoon helps fund peace program
item.description: Rotarian Al Jubitz pledges US$300,000 to endow five Rotary World Peace Fellowships.

item.title: Shining the light of literacy in Brazil
item.description: A Rotarian literacy initiative supported by a Rotary Foundation 3-H grant has helped thousands of Brazilian children learn to read and write.

item.title: Rotarian to donate $2 million to help end polio
item.description: Harshad Mehta pledges to donate the money to Rotary’s polio eradication efforts over the next three years.

item.title: Pacemakers keep hearts beating
item.description: Heartbeat International provided nearly 9,000 heart devices for low-income individuals.

item.title: View International Assembly photos
item.description: See what district governors-elect and other attendees were doing at the assembly.

item.title: Survey says PR an important tool for membership
item.description: About half the respondents said PR helps with retention.

item.title: Rotarians seek aid for victims of violence in Kenya
item.description: More than 650 people were killed, and more than 250,000 are displaced.

item.title: International Assembly photo gallery
item.description: View a gallery of photos from 18 January 2008.

item.title: International Assembly prepares incoming district leaders for challenges
item.description: District governors-elect learn how to meet upcoming challenges.

item.title: Understanding will make difference in ending world poverty
item.description: A Rotarian's fight against poverty.

item.title: Fight continues for district governor and polio survivor
item.description: To physician and polio survivor Urs Herzog, polio is personal.

item.title: International Assembly photo gallery
item.description: View a gallery of photos from January 17, 2008.

item.title: Rotarian on the street
item.description: As the 2008 International Assembly winds down, we asked incoming district governors to share their thoughts on the challenges given to them ...

item.title: Clear vision, proper ethics strengthen Foundation’s future
item.description: Rotary’s leaders will impact the future success of The Rotary Foundation, keynote speakers Past RI Director Ray Klinginsmith and Foundation Trustee Vice Chair Mark Daniel Maloney tells incoming district governors at the International Assembly.

item.title: International Assembly photo gallery
item.description: View a gallery of photos from January 16, 2008.

item.title: Scott announces Rotary's US$100 Million Challenge
item.description: Foundation Trustee Chair Robert S. Scott tells the future district leaders that Rotary US$100 Million Challenge is a priority.

item.title: International Assembly photo gallery
item.description: View a gallery of photos from January 15, 2008.

item.title: The promise of today’s Rotary Foundation
item.description: Foundation Trustee Chair Robert S. Scott discusses the 2007-08 Foundation goals.

item.title: Speakers stress membership growth, leadership, during plenary
item.description: At the International Assembly, incoming district governors are asked to make membership growth a focal point in the upcoming year.

item.title: Video: Lee asks Rotarians to ‘Make Dreams Real’
item.description: Watch as Rotary International President-elect Dong Kurn Lee announces the 2008-09 RI theme at Rotary International Assembly.

item.title: Rotarian on the street
item.description: We asked district governors-elect, “What does the 2008-09 RI theme, Make Dreams Real, mean to you and your district?”

item.title: Foundation looks to the future with new goals
item.description: Enhancing Rotary’s public image and asking clubs and districts to partner more with The Rotary Foundation are just two of the new 2008-09 Foundation goals.

item.title: Emphases key to Lee’s lofty challenge
item.description: President-elect Dong Kurn Lee urges Rotarians to reduce the world’s child mortality rate.

item.title: International Assembly photo gallery
item.description: View a gallery of photos from January 14, 2008.

item.title: Make Dreams Real
item.description: RI President-elect Dong Kurn Lee spoke to incoming district governors at the 2008 International Assembly, urging them to use their resources to help curb the children mortality rate.

item.title: More tools for promoting your club and district
item.description: The fourth edition of Humanity in Motion will by sent to all clubs for use in promoting Rotary locally.

item.title: Going, going, gone – to college
item.description: Need a bowling ball? Maybe some country hams? How about Lasik eye surgery? Then check out the 58th annual benefit auction sponsored by the Rotary Club of Hopkinsville, Ky., USA.

item.title: Canadian Rotaractors’ award-winning project aiding Nicaraguans
item.description: Communities in San Juan del Sur, Nicaragua, are witnessing significant improvements to sanitation and school conditions, thanks to Project Nicaragua, a technological initiative launched in 2004 by the Rotaract Club of University of Calgary, Canada.

item.title: Norway club delivers maternity ward to Kenyan village
item.description: The Røa club donated NKr 100,195 (US$18,205) to construct a maternity ward at the Diani Dispensary in Ukunda, a project of the Diani Rotary club.

item.title: Home makeover surprises family dealing with cancer
item.description: The Rotary Club of Westchester (Los Angeles) paints and landscapes the home of someone who could use the extra help.

item.title: Literacy project hits the road with a renowned African explorer
item.description: Kingsley Holgate team up with U.S. and South African clubs to distribute books, mosquito nets and eyeglasses to children.

item.title: Clubs provide ShelterBoxes for North Korean flood victims
item.description: N. Korea opens its doors for help after nine provinces in the country were hit by heavy rains that left around 300,000 homeless.

item.title: Côte d’Ivoire Rotarian honored for dedication to polio eradication
item.description: Marie-Irène Richmond-Ahoua receives an honor for her work in helping protect her country’s children against polio.

item.title: Son of GSE alums crusades for clean water
item.description: Ryan Hreljac is a typical 16-year-old. He plays sports, spends time on the computer, loves to sleep, and is up to his neck in schoolwork. But there’s one thing that makes him stand out, besides his lanky 6-foot-6-inch frame.

item.title: Rotarians seek aid for cyclone victims in Bangladesh
item.description: In the aftermath of Cyclone Sidr’s destruction in Bangladesh, Rotarians in District 3280 are seeking aid for victims of the 15 November disaster.

item.title: A positive note
item.description: Thanks to a Rotary Foundation Matching Grant project totaling US$4,000, three Brazilian public schools that serve children from poor areas of Rio de Janeiro enhanced their music programs.

item.title: Majla Custo's story
item.description: Growing up in Bosnia-Herzegovina, Majla Custo has seen the devastating effects of war. But she uses her experience as a springboard to help rebuild her country.

item.title: Making the district training cycle work for you
item.description: The numbers don’t lie. According to survey results, district trainers and governors believe the amount of training Rotary recommends is not too little and not too much, but just right.

item.title: Empowered families strengthen Rotary image
item.description: After 75 years, the Rotary Club of Garrettsville-Hiram faced a declining membership and dwindling enthusiasm.

item.title: RYLA participant fights polio in Nigeria
item.description: To graduate from South Tahoe High School, students are required to master a new skill. So, Brittney Cummings talked her way onto a polio immunization trip.

item.title: Past RI Director and Rotary Foundation Trustee Theodoro dies
item.description: Past RI Director Archimedes Theodoro, of Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, Brazil, died 5 December.

item.title: RI president appoints directors-nominee
item.description: It’s official. RI President Wilfrid J. Wilkinson has named eight Rotarians who will serve on the RI Board of Directors in 2009-10 and 2010-11

item.title: After contracting polio, survivor immunizes children
item.description: When Zaheer “Zak” Ahmed finally returned to Pakistan, after being diagnosed with polio and enduring weeks of isolation in Australia, one of the first things he did was sign up for a National Immunization Day.

item.title: Documenting disaster
item.description: An interview with ShelterBox photographer Mark Pearson.

item.title: Raffle winner turns down $30,000 prize
item.description: What would you do if you won US$30,000? For Marc Jacobson, the answer was easy: Give it back.

item.title: U.S. Rotarians aid Cuban schoolchildren
item.description: Nearly 40 Rotarians and other volunteers delivered school supplies to Cuba from 23 November to 1 December.

item.title: Musical fundraising
item.description: Rotarian musicians found a way to keep big-band tunes alive – and make money for The Rotary Foundation.

item.title: Museum exhibit turns into a great public relations tool for clubs
item.description: Rotarians in District 5150 (California) put Rotary on display.

item.title: Gates Foundation grant to Rotary garners worldwide publicity
item.description: Monday’s announcement that Rotary accepted a US$100 million challenge grant from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation that will generate $200 million for polio eradication continues to receive media attention around the globe.

item.title: UNICEF Director says Gates challenge grant will help finish polio
item.description: Watch an interview with Ann Veneman of UNICEF, one of the partners of the Global Polio Eradication Initiative.

item.title: Spread the word about the Gates Foundation challenge grant
item.description: Rotarians are strongly encouraged to share the news of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation’s US$100 million challenge grant to Rotary International with their local media.

item.title: Make plans to attend club-sponsored clean water summit in Haiti
item.description: Find out how your Rotary club can help work for clean water worldwide during a summit 14-15 December in Petion-Ville, Haiti.

item.title: From crawling to walking: A survivor's story
item.description: In the north of India, large numbers of polio survivors require surgery and rehabilitation. Follow the journey of Asif, a 12-year-old boy who contracted polio as an infant.

item.title: Rotary clubs in District 4200 respond to devastating floods in Mexico
item.description: Thousands of people were left homeless after Tropical Storm Noel caused widespread flooding.

item.title: The Rotarian photo contest now open!
item.description: Send us your best shot from 2007-08 that illustrates Service Above Self.

item.title: Clubs in Central America put on project fair
item.description: For many people, January is a time for New Year’s resolutions. But instead of cutting out the carbs this year, why not resolve to find an international project for your Rotary club?

item.title: Foundation honors three couples for major gifts
item.description: Three North American couples were recently inducted into the Arch C. Klumph Society, which honors people who give at least US$250,000 to The Rotary Foundation.

item.title: RI and Gates Foundation commit US$200 million for intensified push to finish polio
item.description: RI has announced a partnership with the Gates Foundation that will inject US$200 million into the effort to eradicate polio.

item.title: Watch the fight to eradicate polio
item.description: View footage from an immunization campaign in Ethiopia.

item.title: Board acts on new-member reporting
item.description: At its October/November meeting, the RI Board agreed to establish a timeline for clubs to report their new members.

item.title: CDC Director commends Rotary’s work to end polio
item.description: Dr. Julie Gerberding recently thanked Rotarians for their tireless work to eradicate polio.

item.title: A historic day for Rotary
item.description: Read a message from RI President Wilkinson and Chair Scott celebrating the partnership between RI and the Gates Foundation for a polio-free world.

item.title: Grant money in motion
item.description: November is Rotary Foundation Month. Need a project idea? Watch a video about a club that put its matching grant into motion teaching schoolchildren math and science in an unconventional way.

item.title: The Rotary calendar: A framework for training
item.description: Club Trainer Jean Constant uses the Rotary Calendar to empower club members.

item.title: Rotary Foundation selects fourth group for peace program
item.description: The Rotary Foundation has selected its fourth group of professionals to study peace-building and conflict resolution in its three-month program in Thailand.

item.title: Three-year pilot program to test new grant structure
item.description: To ensure that the new models for developing and funding grants meet the Future Vision Plan objectives, the Rotary Foundation Trustees and the RI Board approved a preliminary three-year pilot program that begins 1 July 2009.

item.title: Three-year pilot program to test new grant structure
item.description: To ensure that the new models for developing and funding grants meet the Future Vision Plan objectives, the Rotary Foundation Trustees and the RI Board approved a preliminary three-year pilot program that begins 1 July 2009.

item.title: New funding model simplifies process for clubs and districts
item.description: In response to the new Rotary Foundation grant structure, the Future Vision Committee recommended a preliminary distributable funds model that was approved by the Foundation Trustees and then reviewed by the RI Board during the October/November meetings of both boards.

item.title: Rotary, UN celebrate common goals
item.description: Held annually, Rotary-UN day celebrated the organizations’ 62-year partnership.

item.title: Strategic cooperative relationships will enhance service efforts
item.description: A key feature of The Rotary Foundation’s Future Vision Plan involves forming strategic cooperative relationships (SCR) with organizations that can help the Foundation accomplish its mission and the goals of each area of focus.

item.title: New grant structure offers flexibility and strategic focus
item.description: Under the new grant structure model for The Rotary Foundation, all grants will fall into one of two categories and consolidate educational and humanitarian programs.

item.title: Trustees, Board approve future vision models
item.description: At their October/November meetings, The Rotary Foundation Trustees and the RI Board approved the grant structure and strategic cooperative relationships models and a preliminary distributable funds model, all of which form the core of the Foundation’s Future Vision Plan.

item.title: Find out how youth around the globe celebrate World Interact Week
item.description: Interact is a Rotary-sponsored service club for young people ages 14 to 18.

item.title: Rotarians in District 9200 seek additional aid for Ugandan flood victims
item.description: Rotarians in District 9200 (East Africa) are asking Rotarians worldwide to help them secure mosquito nets, blankets, and household kits for thousands of people in Uganda left homeless after weeks of summer rain caused the worst flooding in decades.

item.title: New e-mail scam targeting Rotarians
item.description: RI encourages Rotarians to avoid becoming victims of scams by deleting any e-mail that appears suspicious.

item.title: PR grants help tell many Rotary stories
item.description: More than 1,700 Public Relations Grants of up to US$3,000 were awarded in 2006-07 to help clubs and districts promote Rotary and their projects to the media and the general public.

item.title: Singer Beyoncé Knowles immunizes Ethiopian children against polio
item.description: Rotarians taking part in a polio immunization campaign in Ethiopia recently enjoyed a boost of star power for the eradication effort.

item.title: Rotary club shows India’s future bio-techies the right career formula
item.description: Leaders in biotechnology provided career tips to more than 700 college students in Hyderabad, India, at a September seminar hosted by local Rotary club members.

item.title: Peace forums explore Rotary’s role in bridging differences
item.description: More than 1,000 Rotarians and guests from dozens of countries gathered recently for three Rotary Presidential Peace Forums, which concluded in Nairobi, Kenya, on 20 September.

item.title: How you can help fire victims in Southern California
item.description: Wildfires in Southern California have displaced thousands of families, including Rotarians.

item.title: Iraqi diplomat commends Rotary for humanitarian prosthetics project
item.description: In her work providing artificial limbs to people in Iraq, Rotarian Linda Smythe has worked closely with Samir Sumaidaie, Iraq’s ambassador to the United States.

item.title: Is your club using the RSS feed for RI news?
item.description: RSS is a basic form of Web page that sends news headlines and other Web content to subscribers.

item.title: April’s Project brings clean water to Guatemalans year round
item.description: In the western highlands of Guatemala, residents can obtain water only by walking miles to sparse wells.

item.title: Sorrento, Italy, will host Rotary institute
item.description: District governors from zones 11-14 will join RI directors for a Rotary institute in Italy, 7-11 November.

item.title: Book-toting Rotarians to promote literacy at L.A. convention
item.description: Rotarians who bring a book to the 2008 RI Convention in Los Angeles will help boost literacy.

item.title: Rotary to receive UN Association’s Humanitarian Award
item.description: RI President Wilfrid J. Wilkinson will accept the award on 25 October for the organization's clean water efforts.

item.title: Rotarians travel to Ethiopia to immunize children against polio
item.description: More than 70 Rotarians from the U.S. and Canada are taking part in a nationwide campaign

item.title: Register for 2007 Rotary Day at the United Nations
item.description: Rotarians and their guests are invited to attend Rotary Day at the UN on 3 November in New York.

item.title: How will your club honor World Food Day?
item.description: Learn how several clubs are making sure children have access to nourishing meals through "PowerFlour."

item.title: Persevering against polio
item.description: Embark on a virtual tour of “Whatever Happened to Polio?” an exhibit of the Smithsonian’s National Museum of American History that chronicles the history of the disease and efforts to eradicate it.

item.title: Polio in Pictures
item.description: Two billion children under the age of five have received the oral polio vaccine, sparing an estimated 5 million from a lifetime of paralysis and preventing 500,000 new cases each year.

item.title: Polio in Pictures
item.description: Two billion children under the age of five have received the oral polio vaccine, sparing an estimated 5 million from a lifetime of paralysis and preventing 500,000 new cases each year.

item.title: Rotarians chosen to serve on RI Board
item.description: Zone committees have nominated eight Rotarians from six countries to serve on the RI Board of Directors.

item.title: Arizona couple inducted into the Arch C. Klumph Society
item.description: Jim and Mary Kay Patmos were inducted into the Arch C. Klumph Society, which honors people who give at least US$250,000 to The Rotary Foundation on 1 October.

item.title: New RI officers, Foundation trustees
item.description: At its first meeting of 2007-08, the RI Board approved President Wilfrid J. Wilkinson’s choices for RI officers.

item.title: Oral polio vaccine remains tool of choice in eradication effort
item.description: Rotary and its partners remain committed to reaching all children with the oral polio vaccine (OPV).

item.title: Conferences inspire Rotarians to boost North American membership
item.description: At the seven Share the Magic of Rotary Presidential Conferences, held in July and August, RI President Wilfrid J. Wilkinson called on Rotarians to recruit and retain new members.

item.title: Past RI Director and Treasurer Ford dies
item.description: Past RI Director and Treasurer Luther Ford, of Bloomington, Minnesota, USA, died on 8 October at the age of 96.

item.title: Once divided by Sri Lanka’s conflict, two alumni make peace
item.description: The first encounters between two classmates in the Rotary Peace and Conflict Studies program were anything but cordial.

item.title: Rotary club books a sustainable worldwide reading initiative
item.description: In 1995, the Rotary Club of Parole (Annapolis), Maryland, USA, provided a South African Rotary Foundation Ambassadorial Scholar with books to help promote literacy in South Africa.

item.title: Polio cases reported in Nigeria
item.description: Several news organizations have reported cases of vaccine-derived polio in northern Nigeria.

item.title: Lee visits young heart surgery patients in India
item.description: RI President-elect Dong Kurn Lee visits children recovering from heart surgery funded by Rotarians.

item.title: Vocational project gives Brazilian youth a taste of success
item.description: A Rotary club-sponsored oasis in the middle of the troubled Praça Mauá neighborhood in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is giving teenagers there a foothold into a promising future.

item.title: British Group Study Exchange team prepared for any emergency
item.description: Cowley and four emergency management professionals from England traveled as a Group Study Exchange team to Chicago to learn how other cities prepare for and respond to crises.

item.title: The new face of the RI Web site
item.description: Welcome to the new RI Web site. Over the past year, we’ve worked to streamline your Web experience while building a site that can accommodate future growth.

item.title: Rotaractors seek aid for flood victims in North Korea
item.description: Several Illinois Rotaract clubs are raising money to provide medical assistance for flood victims in North Korea.

item.title: U.S. ShelterBox Response Team delivers landmark aid
item.description: On her first trip delivering disaster relief for ShelterBox, Trannie Lacquey encountered Maoist guerillas, crossed swollen rivers on foot, and hiked miles in a remote, tension-filled corner of Nepal.

item.title: Kenny is choice for 2009-10 RI president
item.description: John Kenny, of the Rotary Club of Grangemouth, Central, Scotland, is the selection of the Nominating Committee for President of Rotary International in 2009-10

item.title: With the help of Rotarians, peace centers bring hope to world
item.description: Advancing world understanding, goodwill, and peace is a part of Rotary’s mission, but to accomplish this in a world strewn with conflict takes commitment.

item.title: Third class graduates from Rotary peace program
item.description: The Rotary Foundation’s third group of students studying peace and conflict resolution at a university in Bangkok, Thailand, will graduate from their intensive, three-month program on 14 September.

item.title: A new look at global ethics and The Four-Way Test
item.description: Moral codes and ethics give us tools but also raise questions to be answered: How should we live?

item.title: Clubs respond to Peru earthquake
item.description: Rotarians are moving into action following a powerful earthquake that rocked Peru on 15 August, killing more than 500 and destroying some 35,000 homes.

item.title: The Rotary Foundation contact center has the answers
item.description: Do you have questions about Foundation programs such as Ambassadorial Scholarships or Group Study Exchange?

item.title: Rotary honors Côte d'Ivoire president for polio eradication leadership
item.description: On 24 July, Rotary International recognized Côte d'Ivoire President Laurent Gbagbo with its Polio Eradication Champion Award in honor of his commitment to eradicating polio worldwide.
